snippet: In his first, rather cautious response to the drought gripping California, the state's new Governor today called on all communities to cut their water use by half, created a "water bank" to transfer water to the neediest areas and asked the Legisl...
lead_paragraph: In his first, rather cautious response to the drought gripping California, the state's new Governor today called on all communities to cut their water use by half, created a "water bank" to transfer water to the neediest areas and asked the Legislature to establish a $100 million drought fund. But the Governor, Pete Wilson, stopped short of invoking emergency powers to take sterner measures, saying he preferred to allow the local authorities to act first.

headline.main: Governor Urges New Water Cuts By Californians

byline.original: By ROBERT REINHOLD, Special to The New York Times
